def is_isogram(word):
    # Check if the input is a string
    if type(word) != str:
        return False
    
    # Check if the input is not empty
    if word == "":
        return False
    
    # Convert the word to lowercase
    word = word.lower()
    
    # Remove non-letter characters
    word = re.sub("[^a-z]", "", word)
    
    # Count the number of occurrences of each letter in the word
    letter_counts = Counter(word)
    
    # Check if all letter counts are the same
    if len(set(letter_counts.values())) == 1:
        return True
    else:
        return False

def is_isogram(word):
    if not isinstance(word, str):
        return False
    if len(word) == 0:
        return False
    word = word.lower()
    word = re.sub(r'[^a-z]', '', word)
    counter = Counter(word)
    max_count = max(counter.values())
    min_count = min(counter.values())
    return max_count == min_count

def is_isogram(word):
    if not isinstance(word, str): # checks if word is not a string
        return False
    if not word: # checks if word is empty or None
        return False
    word = re.sub('[^a-zA-Z]', '', word.lower()) # removes non-letter characters and converts word to lowercase

    letter_count = counter.most_common(1)[0][1] # gets the count of the most common letter
